data.description:
SUPPORTS: English - German - Spanish - French - Italian - Danish

Lets you add pins to the timeline using speech-to-text.
Creating pins in the future can be done by adding a time indication. Only formats shown below are supported!

ENGLISH (12H): "at X:XX (AM/PM)", "at X o'clock", "in XX minutes", "in XX hours"

GERMAN (24H): "um XX:XX (Uhr)", "in XX Minuten", "in XX Stunden"

SPANISH (12H/24H): "a las XX:XX (a.m./p.m./horas)", "en XX minuto(s)", "en XX hora(s)"

FRENCH (24H): "à XXhXX", "dans XX minute(s)", "dans XX heure(s)"

ITALIAN (24H): "alle XX:XX", "in/fra/tra XX minuti", "in/fra/tra XX ore/ora"

DANISH (24H): "på XX:XX", "om XX minut(ter)", "om XX time(r)"

data.description:
Smart assistant for bariatric surgery patients.

Only in the US, over 180 000 people a year undergo some kind of bariatric surgery (gastric plication, sleeve gastrectomy, silastic ring gastric bypass, etc.) which come with strict dietary restrictions. This app is supposed to make those patients' lifes a little easier.

Features:
* Count your 5 meals a day
* Get local and Timeline schedule for your next meal in 3 hours
* Get notified 15 minutes before meal that you should stop drinking
* Get notified 30 minutes after meal that you can get your drink again
* Get your timeline re-scheduled if you eat out-of-schedule

Upcoming:
* Configurable frequency and reminders

data.description:
Introducing Brili for Pebble, the first ever wearable routine assistant for families.

Brili makes kids' daily routines come to life as a fun race against time. It guides them through activities like getting dressed and brushing teeth with the end goal in mind (e.g. leaving for school on time or bedtime). Brili’s dynamic timers automatically adjust to make sure everything gets done by your deadline, even if you started late.

With Brili for Pebble, you or your child can:
- see the current task and a picture of it
- see a visual countdown timer
- receive vibration prompts when time is running low and when time has run out
- mark activities complete, which automatically starts the timer on the next activity

Every minute saved by staying on task is banked for a desirable activity at the end. Brili for Pebble allows you to access daily routines you create for your kids (or yourself!) on the Brili platform using our iOS, Android or web clients.

Note: While Brili for Pebble can function without the app installed on your paired device, the Brili smartphone, tablet or web app is required to create and manage routines. Get it at http://brili.co.

latest_release.release_notes: Brili for Pebble now supports the minimum activity time that can be set using the Brili mobile and web apps.

data.description:
Paris Transilien is an unofficial app for checking SNCF Transilien™ trains on your wrist. Transilien™ is the brand name of the suburban railway service of the SNCF-owned railway network operating within the Île-de-France.

Main features:
1. This app lets you search Transilien train timetables.
2. Information includs departure / pass time, destinations, "Delayed / Canceled" status, stops, and the time of each stop.
3. Search a station name by choosing letters directly on your wrist. For example, you can find Saint-Lazare by only searching "AZA".
4. Long select the search result to add a destination.
5. You can reverse the direction in case you want a return trip.
6. By selecting a train, you can check its schedules and stops.
7. Add your daily itineraries into favorites.
8. Long select a favorite to edit or reorder.
9. The connection indicator in the status bar lets you know if it's ready to load timetables.
10. A soft vibration tells you the loading is finished and successful. 
11. "Low Memory" warning with a triple vibration let you know there's not enough memory to open a new window.

If you have any questions / requests / suggestions, please contact me by mail, or leave an issue in the GitHub project page. If you'd like to participate in the project, welcome to fork the repository on GitHub. Thanks!

latest_release.release_notes:
- Fixed a crash for Pebble Time series.
- Improved text scrolling for Pebble Time Round.
- Adjusted time text for 12h format for Pebble Time Round.
- Some other improvements.

changelog.release_notes:
Improved initial update stability
- Initial update now performed automatically after 2 secs; this should resolve any 'infinite update' issues when starting the app
- Using more aggressive GPS settings (10 sec timeout, 10 sec data age) to improve accuracy

If you should detect any issues, please contact us through the app's github.com page by posting an issue. Thank you!

Added several new features:
  - can now manually choose from the closest bus stops ('*' next to bus stop name on main page indicates manual selection)
    1. press middle button to go to selection screen
    2. up/down to select
    3. middle button to confirm selection
 - now showing up to 21 next buses (7 per page, use up/down buttons to flip pages)
 - shake watch to trigger update
 - different bus lines are highlighted by individual background colors to allow for faster scanning of next buses list
 - improved update status info
 - updates now triggered automatically every 30 seconds

data.description:
Gives bus schedule info for the ASEAG bus network (Aachen, Germany region).

Functionality:
  - Shows up to 21 next buses (7 per page)
    - Use up/down buttons to flip pages
  - Select between automatic or manual bus stop selection ('*' next to bus stop name on main screen indicates manual selection)
    1. Press middle button to go to selection screen
    2. Select desired bus stop using up/down buttons
    3. Confirm selection using middle button
  - Shake watch to trigger update (automatic trigger every 30 seconds)
  - Color highlights for every bus stop line for faster scanning of list

latest_release.release_notes:
Improved initial update stability
- Initial update now performed automatically after 2 secs; this should resolve any 'infinite update' issues when starting the app
- Using more aggressive GPS settings (10 sec timeout, 10 sec data age) to improve accuracy

If you should detect any issues, please contact us through the app's github.com page by posting an issue. Thank you!

data.description:
Starting Timer for Yacht Racing

Counts down to Start with vibration alerts. Multiple operation modes. Developed by experienced sailboat racer.

FEATURES:

Large easy-to-read display with all relevant data and color highlighting.

Standard 5 minute starting sequence by default, but initial number of minutes can be changed.

Short vibrations at 4 minutes, and at seconds from 10 down to Start, long vibrations at 1 minute and at Start.

Jump to prior minute, next minute, or sync to clock by button press.

Remembers timer Mode and Start time when not running.

Wakes up automatically if not running at 10 seconds before Start.

COLOR:

Yellow background for more than 1 minute to Start.
Red background for less than 1 minute to Start.
Green background for count up after Start.

MODES:

Rolling: from one Start into next Start.
Down-Up: counts down to Start and then counts up.
Down-Stop: counts down to Start and stops.

BUTTONS

Top: Jump timer to prior minute.
Long press to stop and reset to initial value or change initial value.

Middle: Start/pause timer toggle.
Long press to sync Start time to nearest clock minute.

Bottom: Jump timer to next minute.
Long press to rotate timer Mode.

CATEGORY: Sailing

data.description:
UPDATED 07 FEB 16

Splatime Monitor is a daily utility app that reports the current and upcoming maps in rotation for the Wii U game 'Splatoon'. Using pebble.js and the splatoon.ink API, the app reports the current maps and the maps for the next 2 rotations, mirroring the information available at splatoon.nintendo.net.

DISCLAIMER: Since this app pulls data from an external API, it will not function properly if it is disconnected from your phone or if your phone cannot connect to the internet.

With the v2.2 update, much of the app's backend has been restructured to handle the current structure of the Splatoon.ink API's response data, and the app's image handling has been updated to work under current firmware's new bitmap handling.

Current features include:

- Color distinction for Random and Ranked maps (Basalt only, Aplite support upcoming b/c WOO GRAY)
- Shake to refresh maps (The app currently also refreshes its map data any time it's closed)
- Autodetection of your local time zone and proper time adjustment
- Error handling for Splatfests or splatoon.ink request failures
- 100% more WOOMY!

For any problems or bugs with the app, please let me know! This is my first watchapp, so I appreciate the feedback. You can reach me through the email link below or you can message me directly on Reddit: /u/greater_nemo.

If you'd like to support Splatime Monitor or future apps, feel free to donate at paypal.me/greaternemo . I do my coding in my free time, so any little bit is appreciated. :)

latest_release.release_notes:
Updated codebase to handle current structure from the Splatoon.ink API response, including the new(ish) splatfest flag.
Added a ton of documentation, including examples of the current API structure that splatmonitor.js is written to process.
Added and updated debug cases to work with the new API structure.
Beautified the entire codebase.
Removed a lot of comments and cruft, including deleting feature.js because idgaf.
Updated all the image handling to work under current firmware versions as bitmap resources.
WOOMY.

data.description:
If you like interval running or just want to try it this app is what you need.
"IntervalRunning" app helps you to track running phase. 
Interval running is a series of low- to high-intensity exercise workouts interspersed with rest or relief periods. For example you could start with 5 seconds run then do 5 seconds walk, then you take 10 seconds to run and 10 seconds to walk. When you reach one minute counting turns back till 5 seconds. Those parameters could be configured with app settings to fit your needs.
Interval training is a technique particularly employed by runners, but athletes in many disciplines use this type of training!

data.author: Peter Summers

changelog.release_notes: Fixes a problem with not being able to send messages twice unless they use the location.

Avoids reading from localstorage before the Javascript ready event.  

Tidied up the configuration page.
Supports the Pebble Time 2.
Long (>30 character) results from the server response are now sent as Pebble notifications, which means that we can handle much longer responses.
Fixed a problem with labels not being saved.

Adds debugging options in configuration.

Stores message headers correctly.
Enabled a Quick GPS option that responds more quickly by doing a single GPS read rather than a run (defaults to off).
Now uses the Clay interface for the settings, which avoids some of the limitations associated with Setpebble system.
Recompiled with SDK 4, includes a Diorite build.
Improved handling of geolocation errors.
Centralises the label text and scales for screen size to fit better on the Pebble Round  and utilise the extra space on the Pebble Time 2.
Improved handling of GPS errors.
Improved handling of confirmation - ~ in the confirmation field will return the result to the watch, ~<field name> will return a particular field from the result.
Compiled for timeline (SDK3) on Aplite.

Won't trigger a second message if a button is pressed to dismiss the status message.

Handles an attempt to trigger a dictation session on a watch without a microphone (in preparation for SDK3 on Aplite).

Initialises the hint_layer pointer to NULL.
Now doesn't try to find it's location unless it's needed => faster response when GPS isn't required.

Enhanced the Tertiary Text input function to provide more space for the text.

Confirmation string can now be used to extend the URL - if a "|" is found in the string then anything before it is added to the url or data segment and only what follows it is used as the confirmation string.
The Tertiary Text input is included for Aplite as a substitute for dictation.

On Basalt, ~Txt is replaced with some text dictated to the watch.  

Accepts multiple dictation sessions, so you can configure it to do something like "send the text message I dictate to the number that I dictate" (with the aid of a suitable HTTP to SMS service).

data.description:
GPS-aware HTTP client supporting GET and POST requests and server response verification or display.

Allows configuration with three sets of label, URL, JSON data segment (if using POST) and string to check for in the response to verify that the server accepted the message or specifying which part of the response to display on the watch (if starting with ~).

For example, the label might be 'I am OK." and the URL/data fields contain the string:

http://server.domain.com/folder/subfolder
{"SenderId":"Peter","Text":"~Lbl",
"Lat":~Lat,"Long":~Lon,"Accuracy":~Acc}.

The URL and data can be spread across four setting strings to allow for long URL's.

In the URL and data, ~Lat will be replaced with the latitude, ~Lon with the longitude, ~Acc with the accuracy, ~Alt with the altitude, ~Spd with the speed, ~Hed with the heading, ~Lbl with the label text, ~Adr with your street address, ~Gmp with a URL to your location on Google maps and ~Txt with your dictated text.

If you don't have a server of your own, you could use one of the many public SMS-sending services to send text messages for you, e.g. 
http://www.smsglobal.com/http-api.php?
action=sendsms&user=<user>&password=<password>
&from=Peter&to=61456789123&text=~Lbl at ~Adr (see ~Gmp).

This app is provided as is - you are responsible for testing this app thoroughly and determining whether it works appropriately and meets your needs.  The source code is available if you want to examine how it works or customize it.

If you find it useful, please give it a heart.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixes a problem with not being able to send messages twice unless they use the location.

data.description: Are you dreaming? Are you dreaming right now? Learn to recognize when you are dreaming. Look away from your watch then look back. Notice anything strange? If you are dreaming, it's likely that the text won't make sense. It might appear as cryptic, meaningless glyphs. Often, when dreaming, digital displays will appear as gibberish when you really take a moment to look. When you get in the habit of entertaining the possibility that you are dreaming at any given moment, the frequency of becoming lucid, i.e., recognizing that you are dreaming while you are dreaming, increases dramatically. ཨ Set time between "reality checks" with + or - (long press to go by 20 minute intervals) ཨ Before bed, choose 8hr (your usual interval will resume in the morning) The app will "pinch" you and ask if you are dreaming. Even if you think you are awake, it's best to do one or more "reality checks" to be sure: ཨ gently attempt to push two fingers through the palm of your other hand ཨ hold your nose, close your mouth and try to breathe ཨ look at a digital watch such as your Pebble ཨ flip a light switch When you are dreaming, you may be surprised that these things don't work as expected. If they don't, go explore your very own dream world! What you can do in a dream is only limited by your imagination and as you become more familiar with dreaming, the limits of your imagination will expand.

data.description:
As Fitbit acquired Pebble we will stop supporting the integration of Pebble watches in the iOS and Android versions of the game.

However, we won't remove the game from the Pebble app store since we don't want to screw existing users the way Pebble and Fitbit just did :-/

Nuggetz is a FREE TO PLAY reaction game for the Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round. It is based upon the Stroop effect. The task is easy: Just name the color in which a word is written, not the word itself. If you make a mistake the game is over.

Sounds easy? Just give it a try and play the game for free. Tell your friends to play it as well and find out, who can score the highest.

Control your Netatmo® Thermostat(s) from your Pebble®!

First time, you have to enter your Netatmo® credentials on the app's configuration page.

Features:
- Supports multiple thermostats
- Change setpoint temperature
- Change active mode (Away, Frost-Guard, Max, Off)

Displays
- the setpoint temperature on the top
- the current measured temperature on the bottom
- the currently active mode (Program, Away mode, Frost-Guard)

You can change the setpoint temperature with the up/down buttons. The middle buttons shows a menu with the available modes that you can activate and you can change the active Thermostat if you have more than one.

Pemostat not developed by Netatmo® or Pebble®. I only made it to control my loved Thermostat.

If you find it useful, please donate under the website link.

This watchapp shows status information and helps you control your AVM FRITZ!Box Smart Home.

First open the configuration page and enter your login data. F!B-Switch supports english and german (description below).

Use the select (middle) button in the menu:
- short -> show details
- long -> switch on/off
Turn on the fast switch mode to change the short/long usage.

Works on AVM FRITZ!Box with Smart Home Support (>=FRITZ!OS 6.20).
Before using https, please install the certificate on your smartphone.

Feel free to contact me and if you like this app, you're welcome to donate via configuration page.
This app and the developer are not associated with AVM GmbH, Berlin (http://www.avm.de)

-- Deutsch --

Die App zeigt Statusinformationen und hilft bei der Steuerung deines AVM FRITZ!Box Smart Home.

Bitte zuerst auf der Einstellungsseite die Zugangsdaten eingeben.

Funktion der mittleren Taste im Menü:
- kurz -> Detailansicht
- lang -> Schalten
Mit eingeschalteter Schnellschaltung wechselt die Funktionsweise.

Funktioniert auf AVM FRITZ!Box mit Smart Home Unterstützung (>=FRITZ!OS 6.20).
Vor der Nutzung von https, bitte das Zertifikat auf dem Smartphone installieren.

Sende einfach eine Mail, wenn es Fragen gibt, und wenn Dir die App gefällt, freue ich mich über eine Spende (über die Einstellungsseite erreichbar).
Die App und der Entwickler sind nicht mit der AVM GmbH, Berlin (http://www.avm.de) verbunden.

AVM FRITZ!DECT 200/210
